questions.question: In our organization, evidence must be presented to support decisions made.
In our organization, people often make assertions that they cannot support.
In our organization, it is easy to get access to the data I need to make good decisions.
In our organization, when making decisions we place more emphasis on evidence than on personal opinions.
In our organization, you can persuade people to do things even if the evidence doesn’t support your arguments.
In our organization, people take the time to gather and analyze data before making decisions.
If you want to get ahead just keep insisting that everything is going great, even if the evidence says something different.
My boss will say whatever it takes to pursue their agenda.
When my boss speaks, they usually back up their opinions with logic.
My boss often says things that may or may not be true.
Even when people don’t know what they are talking about, my boss will often go along with their suggestions.
My boss loves to use acronyms.
My boss loves to use jargon.
In our organization, people use jargon far too often.
In our organization, people use acronyms far too often.
